plugins.name: Resize Frame to Contents
plugins.description:
Resize Frames, or Main Components; to fit their contents one or multiple edges at the same time. Or adjust the padding of Auto Layout frames, or Main Components.


How to use Resize Frame to Contents ❓

  1. Select one or more frames;
  2. Run plugin;
  3. The plugin will automatically filter the selection for Frames and Main Components;
  4. If the Frame, or Main Component, has Auto Layout the plugin will update the padding value for the selected edge(s).
  5. If not, the plugin will adjust the Frame, or Main Component, to fit its content in the selected edge(s). Note that Shadows, Outside Strokes, and other effects count as part of the contents.


Use Cases 🔨

  • Adjusting one or more Frames, or Main Components, to their contents;
  • Make sure an icon pack has consistent padding;
  • Make sure all app screens have consistent spacing around the contents;
  • Anything else you find it useful for!


In Detail 🔎

  • Any type of layers can be selected, the plugin will then look for Frames or Main Components within that selection;
  • A Main Component will have its Auto Layout padding value updated, an Instance will not;
  • The operation time will increase if a large amount of Frames or Main Components is selected;
  • The plugin will measure the success of the operation by showing how many frames had their dimensions or Auto Layout padding changed.


❤ Resize Frame to Contents? Buy me a coffee!
plugins.tagline: Trim Frames, or Main Components; to fit their contents one or multiple edges at the same time.

plugins.name: Bricks - AI Powered Design to TailwindCSS Code
plugins.description:
Bricks is an open source design to code tool built by developers for developers. Here is a video demo of how Bricks works.


AI Powered Design To Code

Here is how Bricks is different from other design to code tools.

  • 🛎️ Bricks is only a button click. There is beauty in simplicity.
  • ☁️ No need to install anything. Bricks let you develop in the cloud.
  • 🤝 Share generated code with stake holder for instant feedbacks and collaborations.
  • 🧠 Decent code aided by AI that knows how to use for loops and
  • 📚 Open source


Getting started

  1. Install Bricks Figma plugin
  2. Click "Generate Code" button
  3. Preview and develop code in browser
  4. Share with others


If you want integration with your IDE

Install our VSCode extension:

  1. Install Node.js if you haven't already.
  2. Install both the VS Code extension and the Figma plugin.
  3. Open any folder in VS Code. Bricks won't work if you don't have anything open.
  4. Click on "Activate Bricks" in VSCode's status bar in the right corner to activate the plugin.
  5. In Figma, select components to convert to code.
  6. Click “Generate”.
  7. Done! The generated code shows up in VS Code, along with a live preview👏


 👩‍💻Supported frameworks:

  • React


 🧑‍💻Supported UI libraries:

  • TailwindCSS
  • CSS


 👨‍💻Supported Languages:

  • HTML
  • Javascript
  • Typescript


Your feedbacks are incredibly valuable to us. If you like what we are doing, smash the like button or gift us a star on our Github repository. If you feel there are missing features, you can open up an Github issue or contact us at our Discord server.


If you are passionate about frontend technologies, writing recursive functions, and working with abstract syntax tree, you are definitely suited to becoming a Bricks open source contributor. Email me if you are interested in collaborating on this project.
plugins.tagline: Bricks is an open source design to code tool built by developers for developers

plugins.name: psd.to.design — by ‹div›RIOTS — Import any Adobe Photoshop file (.psd, .psb) to Figma
plugins.description:
Convert any Adobe Photoshop (.psd) document into Figma designs.


Import your Adobe Photoshop (.psd, .psb) files into Figma as designs with fully-editable layers, or as pixel-perfect images.


All files are kept 100% private on your local machine and never sent to any server. We never see your documents.


How to import a Adobe Photoshop (.psd or .psb) file into Figma:

  1. Drag-and-drop or upload your .psd or .psb file into psd.to.design plugin.
  2. Select how you want to import your file: as editable layers or static images.
  3. In a few seconds your file will be converted into editable Figma designs!


Why use psd.to.design?

  1. Extract images and text from your Adobe Photoshop and get them straight into Figma.
  2. Keep your Photoshop layer in Figma.
  3. Iterate from existing .psd or .psb designs in Figma.


Key features

  1. Convert Adobe Photoshop (.psd, .psb) files into fully-editable Figma layers.
  2. Replace missing fonts.
  3. Supports text styles like colors, weights, sizes etc.
  4. Import vectors, ready to be edited in Figma.
  5. Vector clipping masks.
  6. Vector strokes.
  7. Imports all layers including hidden ones.


------------------------------

Brought to you by ‹div›RIOTS

💬 Chat with us

------------------------------

accepted.name: divRIOTS
accepted.description: Making better tools so designers and developers can focus on what matters and work collaboratively as a team.

plugins.tagline: Convert any Adobe Photoshop file into editable Figma designs.

plugins.name: Map Builder
plugins.description:
Revolutionize your design process with Map Builder for Figma. This powerful plugin allows you to seamlessly integrate maps within your design projects, offering a range of features that cater to both functionality and aesthetics. Enhance your projects with detailed maps that align perfectly with your design vision.


Features:


  1. Layer Selection: Effortlessly select specific layers within your Figma file to start building and integrating your maps.
  2. Map Integration: Integrate various map types directly into your designs, including roadmaps, satellite views, and terrain maps. Choose between Google Maps and Mapbox for a versatile mapping experience.
  3. Google Maps and Mapbox Functions: Create and visualize routes between multiple points, ideal for travel planning and logistics visualization.
  4. Free Usage and Upgrade Option: Enjoy a limited number of free map creations, with the option to upgrade to unlimited usage for a nominal fee.
  5. License Management: Enter your license code to unlock unlimited map-building capabilities and access premium support.
  6. User Notifications: Stay informed with notifications about your usage limits and easily upgrade to continue using the plugin without interruptions.
  7. Customer Support: Reach out to our dedicated support team for any assistance, ensuring a smooth and productive experience with the plugin.


Why Choose Map Builder?


Map Builder is designed to provide designers with a comprehensive tool for integrating maps within Figma. Whether you’re working on travel guides, logistical plans, or location-based projects, Map Builder offers the flexibility and functionality needed to create stunning maps.


Get Started Today!


Download and install Map Builder from the Figma Community Store and take your design projects to the next level with the power of integrated maps.
plugins.tagline: Design, Customize, and Integrate Stunning Maps Seamlessly with Map Builder for Figma.

plugins.name: Get Your Palletes
plugins.description:
Get Your Palettes: Effortless Color Creation for Designers


Transform your design workflow with Get Your Palettes, the ultimate Figma plugin for effortless color palette creation. Say goodbye to the tedious process of manually assembling colors and hello to instant, beautiful palettes tailored to your needs.


Key Features:

  • Instant Palette Creation: Generate stunning color palettes with a single click. No more manual adjustments or guesswork!
  • Customizable Options: Tailor your palettes with additional color options based on your preferred categories such as moods, themes, or design requirements.
  • User-Friendly Interface: Enjoy a sleek, intuitive interface that makes palette creation a breeze, whether you're a beginner or a seasoned designer.
  • Save & Reuse: Save your favorite palettes for easy access and reuse them across multiple projects for consistent branding and design language.


Why Choose Get Your Palettes?

  • Boost Productivity: Save valuable time and focus on what you do best – designing!
  • Enhance Creativity: Explore new color combinations and find inspiration with our dynamic palette generator.
  • Seamless Integration: Works effortlessly within Figma, complementing your design process without any interruptions.


Unlock the power of effortless color management with Get Your Palettes. Elevate your designs with beautiful, cohesive palettes created in an instant!


Ready to revolutionize your design workflow? Let's chat! Reach out to me to discuss ideas, provide feedback, or just connect over a virtual coffee. Let's sprinkle some color magic and craft amazing designs together! Drop me a line at www.dragonfly378.my.id – I can't wait to hear from you! 🎨☕️

plugins.name: Tracking
plugins.description:
Make your team metrics focused! This plugin allows you to create, attach and update tracking annotations directly from your Figma file.

• Communicate precisely with your developers what should be tracked 
• Make sure you track the right things and have a visual breakdown of your tracking
• Know whether a tracking was implemented or not
• Provide a visual context about your tracking to anyone in your team or company

✨Take our interactive Figma tutorial
→ http://bit.ly/TrackingTutorial ← 

To start a tracking annotation ...

plugins.name: Figma Duotones — Add duotone effects to your images and elements
plugins.description:
Figma Duotones is a powerful plugin designed to enhance your Figma designs by applying beautiful duotone effects to your images. With an intuitive interface and a range of customizable options, you can easily create visually striking graphics that stand out.


Features:

1. Blending Mode:

Apply custom light and dark colors to blend your images seamlessly with your design.


2. Overlay Mode:

Enhance your images with overlay effects using predefined or custom color overlays for a dynamic look.


3. Intensity Control:

Adjust the intensity of the duotone effect to achieve the perfect balance for your images.


4. Swap Colors:

Easily swap the light and dark colors with a single click to explore different duotone variations.


5. Save Presets:

Save your custom duotone settings as presets for quick access and consistent design across projects.


6. Load Presets:

Load previously saved presets to apply your favorite duotone effects instantly.


7. Download Options:

Download your duotone images in PNG or JPG format and choose between 1x or 2x resolution for high-quality exports.


8. Insert Image:

Directly insert the duotone images into your Figma project, either replacing the selected image or adding a new image layer.


9. Customizable Duotone Color Picker:

Select and fine-tune your light and dark colors with a user-friendly color picker.


10. Preset Image Gallery:

Browse through and apply various preset duotone effects for quick inspiration and implementation.


With Figma Duotones, you can effortlessly elevate your designs with professional-grade duotone effects, making your visuals more engaging and impactful.


Here's how you can contribute:


A quick and easy way to show your appreciation for Figma Duotones is by buying me a coffee.


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/lucksy


Cheers!

plugins.name: Spaces
plugins.description:
Insert and swap space instances in autolayouts.


Naming convention

In order for the plugin to find your spacing components and order them from the smallest to the largest, each spacing component should follow this convention: space_ + [value]

example: space_8 / space_16 / etc.


Inserting/Swapping

When clicking a space in the list, the output will differ based on the current selection (that can be multiple objects or layers).

  1. If an object or layer part of an autolayout is selected, the space instance will be insterted after/before it (according to the state of the position toggle).
  2. If a space instance is selected, the new space instance will replace it.
  3. If nothing or any another type of object or layer is selected, the space instance will be inserted in the center of the viewport.


Visibility

The visibility toggle shows or hides the spacing instances that are part of the active selection.


This plugin was created for the AREA 17 design team and is a variation of the original Spacers plugin by the UX 82 team.

accepted.name: David Lamothe
accepted.description: Group design director @AREA17

plugins.name: motifXD Design Token Generator
plugins.description:
This is DesignOps and handoffs between designer to dev just got a whole lot easier! Designers create and update their styles in Figma, we translate those styles and create an API, all while the devs sit back and get it in directly into their codebase.


----------


Adding New Tokens

Add tokens from anywhere in your figma file. Our plugin will automatically add it to your custom Design System page.

  1. Navigate to either the Color or Text tab at the bottom of the Tokens page.
  2. Use the add to add a new token.
  3. Give the token a name*
  4. Select the token properties
  • For Color, select a color from the color picker.
  • For Text, select the font family, font weight, font size, and line height. Line height - set it to 0 for auto.


Editing Tokens

  1. Navigate to either the Color or Text tab at the bottom of the Tokens page.
  2. Hover over the token and press the edit icon.
  3. Any changes you make will be reflected in that token.


Deleting Tokens

  1. Navigate to either the Color or Text tab at the bottom of the Tokens page.
  2. Hover over the token and press the delete icon.


Visualize your tokens

Our plugin creates a custom Design System page, located at the top of the Pages list on the left sidebar. Here, you can visualize all your tokens in one place. 

Note: Use the plugin to do the actual adding and editing of the tokens.


Naming your tokens

To play nice for the developers, we will use dashes in place of spaces and slashes. For example, instead of "primary purple", we will use "primary-purple". Instead of "primary/purple", we will use "primary-purple". 

Note: When editing, use the name with dashes.


----------


🎯 TEMPLATE

We have a starting template that has a small set of tokens for you to begin with.

Template:

https://www.figma.com/community/file/1176585897297925520



WHAT'S NEXT

  • Deploy feature: Generating an API to get these tokens to your devs.
  • Design dashboard: See all your deployments in one place.
  • Browser Testing inside Figma: See your tokens in action and run testing before they get to your devs!


----------


Feedback? Questions? Feature request?

  • Leave a comment
  • 💻 motifxd.com
  • ✉️ team@labxd.com

accepted.name: Jimmy Nguyen
accepted.description: DesignOps development to create more meaningful designer and dev experiences XD

plugins.tagline: Create, update, delete tokens in a single place

plugins.name: Multi images importer
plugins.description:
Import many images (and their names if needed) from local storage to your design.

The plugin will search for all the layers by given name and will apply the images as frame background.


Latest demo is here.

Support my work here <3


If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)



Scenario:

You created a component that will contain an image and maybe the image description. You have many instances and want to use more that one image from your storage in your design.


How it works:

  1. Select import mode:
  2. Run plugin on all frames in selection - This option will find all image frames in selection and apply images as one group
  3. Run plugin on each frame in selection - This option will find image frames in each frame in selection, and apply images to each frame separately
  4. Provide the layer name that will contain the imported images.
  5. If you want to import the image name as well, provide the text layer name that will contain the name.
  6. Select the images from our local folder
  7. The plugin will search for the layers by the given name and will import the data to these layers:
  8. If a frame is selected - the plugin will search for the layers in the selected frame
  9. If nothing is selected, the plugin will search for layers in the entire page
  10. If multiple frames where selected, the plugin will run separately on each frame


Enjoy :)
plugins.tagline: Import multiple images from your local storage

plugins.name: Screenshots Uploader
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to select multiple images on your mobile phone and upload them directly to figma design file by pre-compressing it.


How to use it?

  • Run plugin in your design file or FigJam board
  • Scan QR code with your mobile phone
  • Select images you wish


Open settings page

You can adjust settings that saved on your device by pressing on panel where "Select Images" live. Сlick on the text to the left of the button.

Here you can configure compression rules for attached images of different sizes.


Upload when plugin is inactive

Once you scan QR code app will save this information. And you can upload images even when plugin is not running. Uploaded images will wait for the plugin to pick them up the next time it is launched. the sequence is not important. Run plugin and then upload or upload and then run plugin.


PWA client

Install this PWA app for further launching via icon from your home screen.
plugins.tagline: Upload screenshot images from mobile phone directly to figma

  • Show spaces in all of the auto-layouts in the page.
  • Hide them.
  • Show only spacing between items, or only paddings.
  • Choose different units for the value of spaces (px, rem or a custom pixel ratio).
  • Choose to keep or not spaces after closing the plugin.
  • Spaces are shown with different colors, each color corresponding to a specific value.


Feedback

Thank you!

plugins.name: Export Variants
plugins.description:
Easily export your variants to SVG.


Figma variants are neat however they can be frustrating to export since you can't control the naming scheme. This plugin lets you export your variants in two key ways: folders and file names.


Folders

Variant names are used for each folder letting you combine component sets together.


File names

A flat, simple approach that creates helpful filenames based on each variant name.


Note

When using a boolean variant the property name will be used for the "true" or "on" state while variants with "off" or "false" states will have the property omitted.

plugins.name: Swap Variables
plugins.description:
This plugin swaps all bound variables in selection with their local counterparts or with a team library.


How it works.

  1. Select frames you want to work with
  2. Run the plugin and select target library
  3. Plugin checks for team libraries connected to the file
  4. Plugins check for local variables in the file
  5. When adding fresh library via Assets → Libraries you need to reload the file to see them in the list
  6. Hit "Swap Variables" button
  7. Plugin replaces all variables bound to an element with the source library

plugins.name: LiveDesign
plugins.description:
LiveDesign is your new favorite Figma-to-Code assistant.


It has the following features:

  1. 🎨 Generate code in HTML and your favorite frameworks, such as React and Vue.
  2. 💅 Support for TailwindCSS or Inline CSS, eliminating messy CSS classes and providing only production-ready code.
  3. 👀 Preview the generated code, ensuring it is perfect before handoff.
  4. 😮 Add state effects (hover, disable, focus…) and responsivity, doing all frontend work right in Figma: just add tailwind classes on the frame name.
  5. 🏞 Assets download: One-click to download all your design assets.
  6. 🔃 Github Sync: send your designs & assets to Github in a click. Any changes in Figma are live in your product!


LiveDesign is 100% free to use. Try LiveDesign today and speed up your frontend workflow!


⛔️ Important: to get the most out of the plugin, please use 'auto-layout' as much as possible!


If you love the plugin, please consider leaving a like on the Figma store, and don't hesitate to send me any feedback at hello@livedesign.app.

plugins.name: Sapling.ai - Grammar Checker and Writing Assistant
plugins.description:
Improve your writing with spelling and grammar suggestions.


Spell check and grammar checking and correction for your writing in Figma.


Sapling is an AI extension that makes grammar and spelling suggestions to help you write on-point messages and content.

Sapling uses deep learning technology (akin to GPT-2/GPT-3) to provide the best recommendations.


Use Sapling to:

• Correct spelling/typos (e.g. grammer) and use as a grammar checker or to rephrase.

• Maintain professional writing tone across your business team.


Sapling goes beyond spelling, punctuation, and grammar correction. Features include:

• 60% more grammar mistakes caught than other tools.

• Compare for yourself against tools like Grammarly (Grammerly), LanguageTool, WhiteSmoke, ProWritingAid, and Quillbot.

• Better grammar and writing suggestions over time.


Secure data processing:

• Sapling undergoes external testing and audits.

• Enterprise-grade security policies and procedures.

• Sapling also provides an API and self-hosted offering.


Multi-lingual support - English is supported by default across multiple languages; Chinese, German, Spanish, French, Italian, Japanese, and Portuguese are also offered (check the Sapling settings dashboard).


Please send feedback to: team@sapling.ai

plugins.name: Auto Number
plugins.description:
Automatically mark width and height in Figma.


Function demonstration video.


Using this plug-in, you can do interactive measurement effects in your Figma documents, directly label the width and height, you only need to follow the steps below:


1. Create a new text node with any content text.


2. Input the text node in a frame.


3. Select the text node in the frame and turn on the [Node under control] switch in the plugin panel. At this time, the content of the text node will be replaced with the width number of the outer frame.


4. Adjust the measurement settings you need, click [Apply all] button, then the plug-in settings will be applied to all nodes in the document that are set to [Node under control].


5. Add auto layout and label lines in your frame, and then adjust the frame width, you can achieve the effect of the demo video.


6. If you just need the prefix of the label and want to switch the width and height of the text, just rotate the outer frame.


Notice:


1. The plug-in can only recognize the width of the container frame. To mark the height, please refer to the demo video.


2. After optimization, when adjusting the size of a single label, there will be no stalls, but if there are many annotations in the document, such as hundreds of them, there may be a short stall when clicking [Apply all] button.


3. You can directly copy the finished label and reset its width, just like the demo video.


3. The plugin will automatically recognize your font.


4. You need to keep the plugin turned on to use the functions.


5. After closing the plug-in, the set options will not be retained. If you need to retain the setting function, please feedback in the comment area.


在figma内自动标注宽高


使用本插件，你可以在你的figma文档中实现交互式标注效果，直接标注宽高，你只需要按以下步骤进行操作：


1.新建一个文本节点，内容文字任意


2.把文本节点装在一个frame里


3.选中frame里的那个文本节点，打开插件中的【是否受插件控制】开关，此时文本节点的内容会被替换为外层frame的宽度


4.调整你需要的标注设置，点击【应用全部】，此时插件设置会应用到文档里全部设置了【是否受插件控制】的节点上


5.给你的frame添加自动布局和标注线，再调整frame宽度时，就可实现演示视频的效果


6.如果你恰好需要标注的前缀，想要切换宽高的文字，旋转标注frame就可以了


注意：


1.插件只能识别容器frame的宽度，要标注高度可以参考演示视频


2.经过优化，在调整单个标注的大小时，不会出现卡顿，但如果文档中有很多标注，比如几百个，点击【应用全部】时可能会出现短暂卡顿


3.可以直接复制做好的标注并重新设置其宽度，就像演示的那样


3.插件会自动识别你的字体


4.你需要保持插件开启才可以使用功能


5.关闭插件后，设置好的选项不会保留，如果你们需要保留设置功能请在评论区反馈

plugins.name: Retro Super Storm
plugins.description:
This plugin is ideal for team meetings. No need to buy new software, all of this already exists in Figma. Simple and self-explanatory UI will make your meetings easy and productive.

The plugin already has templates for Retrospective, Brainstorm and User Story Mapping. Also, the plugin has a built-in timer so you can follow the timing of each iteration.

1. Run the plugin.
2. Choose the template that you need for your meeting.
3. Hold the meeting in a comfy Figma environment.
The host has access to the timer, and time is available to everyone.

plugins.name: Glyph Explorer
plugins.description:
🔍 View glyphs at a glance

  1. View glyphs with a specified font
  2. Favourite your most used characters
  3. Filter and search for glyphs within unicode blocks
  4. Useful for viewing ornament/dingbat fonts in Figma


✨ To upgrade

  1. Upgrading is a one time payment of $12, and includes all future updates and unlimited usage
  2. Features include listing additional unicode characters
  3. Specify custom unicode characters/ranges


♥️ You may contact Figma if you are unsatisfied with your purchase in any way.


---


❣️ Due to some code limitations, font styles may not always load properly, particularly if the font uses unorthodox font style naming conventions. Unfortunately there isn't really a nice way to get around this at this stage.


❣️ This plugin does not replace the glyphs functionality in Adobe apps. Effort has been made to make this plugin as intuitive as possible, however since no local font is accessed, not all glyphs may be shown.


If you have any suggestions for improvements please leave a comment or email me at jaclyntan02@gmail.com!

plugins.name: Figmage
plugins.description:
Figmage makes it easy to embed your Figma designs on websites and in other places.


Just copy the link we provide and use it anywhere just like this:


<img src="https://figmage.com/myimage"/>


Publish your changes to update your images, and manage it all from Figma. You don't need to go back and forth from developer to designer to update assets anymore.


Uses

Use Figmage wherever you embed images. We have people using Figmages in a lot of different places. See them on our website


  • Design System Documentation
  • Blog Posts
  • Social Media Covers
  • Link Meta Previews
  • Portfolios


Cost

Figmage is free to trial for up to 10 images. After that it's $5/mo for more images. You can upgrade from the app.


If you want a team account to share between multiple members, reach out

plugins.name: Dev Variables
plugins.description:
This Dev Variables plugin serves the purpose of transforming Figma variables into a JSON format that is readily usable in development.

Its use cases include:

  • Generating translation files for languages like Arabic (ar.json) and English (en.json)
  • Extracting design system token (colors, radius...) for use in development.


The plugin now includes a convenient copy button for copying the JSON data. Additionally, I'm currently working on adding the functionality to download the JSON as a file and the ability to push them directly to your GitHub repository.

accepted.description: Product Manager at Presto.app

plugins.name: Telior - Developer Assistant (HTML, React, Flutter, Swift)
plugins.description:
⚡️Instantly transform your design into developer-friendly code.

⏳ No registration. No paywall. Simple and performant.

✅ Supports TailwindCSS in HTML and React.

💯 Contextual awareness, Flex and Grid layout, ...


For quicker support, please join our Discord: https://discord.gg/GSqBEmxhZH


FAQ


Q: Is it free?

A: Yes, the base plugin for code generation will always be free. There is a premium plan coming that will support hosting images.


Q: Is generated code pixel-perfect?

A: For the most case, yes. But we are more focus on generating succinct, responsive, and developer friendly code. So in some rare cases the exported code will deviate slightly from the figma. But because the code is easy to read, you can easily add any changes needed.


Q: Who is this for?

A: This is mostly for developers who want to quickly generate basic structure for the design, and expect to modify it slightly to achieve the final result.

plugins.name: Getillustrations Icons, Illustrations and 3D Design Assets
plugins.description:
Access a Library of unique Hand-Drawn Vector Assets – Updated Weekly!


The Getillustrations Figma Plugin brings the entire illustrations bundle to your Figma workspace, including all new weekly updates with fresh icons and illustrations. Our assets are fully hand-drawn from scratch, crafted through years of market research, and shaped by client feedback, establishing us as a trusted authority in the world of unique and high-quality vector assets. With over 11 years in the industry, we are dedicated to providing designers and creators with unparalleled quality and innovation in every style.


Key Features:

  1. Expansive Asset Library: Access Thousands of illustrations, icons, 3D graphics, and stickers in various styles and categories, with new additions every week.
  2. Quick and Easy Search: Find assets quickly with our powerful local search, filtered by style, category, free or premium access. Getillustrations ensures a fast and intuitive browsing experience so you can focus on creating.
  3. Limitless Customization: Easily drag and drop assets into your design, with full vector editing options, including color and size adjustments. Designed to adapt to your needs, each asset maintains its quality across any customization.
  4. Fully Integrated with Figma: No need to switch tools—Getillustrations is seamlessly built into Figma, enabling you to browse, preview, and use assets directly within your design environment.
  5. Hand-Drawn Uniqueness: Our illustrations are one-of-a-kind, developed from scratch based on years of client feedback and research, making each style distinctive and tailored to current market needs.


Why Choose Getillustrations?

Our dedication to originality and quality has made us an industry leader in illustration and icon design. With Thousands of assets and continuous weekly updates, you’ll always find fresh assets for your projects. The Getillustrations plugin offers both free and premium options to suit any design requirement.


What Users Are Saying

"A fantastic library of high-quality illustrations that bring projects to life. It’s user-friendly and comprehensive." — Lucas Diab

"The styles are diverse and perfect for my work. It’s my go-to for unique and well-crafted illustrations." — Julian Colina

"An essential tool for designers! The organization and variety make it a top resource for any creative project." — Joe Taylor


FAQ:

  1. What license do I have on these assets? You have a Standard Commercial Usage License with unrestricted use in your or your clients’ designs. There are no limitations on views or projects.
  2. What does the plugin offer? Free users enjoy access to high-resolution free illustration packs. Paid users unlock the entire library without restrictions or download limits
  3. Do I have to create an account? Yes, logging in connects you to the Getillustrations library. Signing up is simple and can be done via Google for a seamless experience.
  4. What about free sets? Free sets and low-quality assets are available with https://www.getillustrations.com/. Premium users have unrestricted use without attribution.
  5. More questions? Reach out to our support team via the chat widget on our website for additional help.


Unlocking Full Access:

As a free user, you gain access to low-resolution PNGs for all our assets, with high-quality images available for free sets. To unlock the entire library, simply upgrade on Getillustrations.com and link your account. Once upgraded, you’ll instantly have full access to all assets in high resolution right within Figma.


Experience the power of Getillustrations in Figma – where creativity meets quality. Join thousands of designers who rely on our assets to bring their projects to life.

FAQ:

  1. What license do I have on these assets? You have a Standard Commercial Usage License with unrestricted use in your or your clients’ designs. There are no limitations on views or projects.
  2. What does the plugin offer? Free users enjoy access to high-resolution free illustration packs. Paid users unlock the entire library without restrictions or download limits
  3. Do I have to create an account? Yes, logging in connects you to the Getillustrations library. Signing up is simple and can be done via Google for a seamless experience.
  4. What about free sets? Free sets and low-quality assets are available with https://www.getillustrations.com/. Premium users have unrestricted use without attribution.
  5. More questions? Reach out to our support team via the chat widget on our website for additional help.


Unlocking Full Access:

As a free user, you gain access to low-resolution PNGs for all our assets, with high-quality images available for free sets. To unlock the entire library, simply upgrade on Getillustrations.com and link your account. Once upgraded, you’ll instantly have full access to all assets in high resolution right within Figma.


Experience the power of Getillustrations in Figma – where creativity meets quality. Join thousands of designers who rely on our assets to bring their projects to life.

plugins.name: Pantone Hub
plugins.description:
Pantone Hub is your go-to tool for exploring and converting Pantone colors in Figma. Easily browse Pantone libraries or match your custom colors to their Pantone equivalents.


Color Picker:

  1. Choose a Pantone library of your choice.
  2. Browse through the complete list of colors from the selected library. Hover over any color to view its details.
  3. Click on a color to insert it as a token directly into your Figma canvas.
  4. Alternatively, select objects (e.g., rectangles, frames) on your canvas, then click on a color to apply it directly.


Color Converter:

  1. Select a Pantone library to search for matches.
  2. Input a HEX color value to find the nearest or exact Pantone match.
  3. The closest matching color will be displayed.
  4. Click on the color to insert it as a token into your Figma canvas.
  5. Alternatively, apply the color directly to selected objects (e.g., rectangles, frames) on your canvas.

accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.name: Duplicate main component
plugins.description:
Duplicate Main Component' is a time-saving Figma plugin designed for UI/UX designers, front-end developers, and anyone frequently working with component sets in Figma. This plugin effortlessly clones your main component and repositions the duplicate, streamlining your workflow.


Features:


  • One-Click Duplication: With just a single click, replicate your selected main component.
  • Smart Positioning: Automatically places the duplicate below the original, with a customizable margin for neat organization.
  • Viewport Focus: After duplication, the plugin zooms in on the new component, making immediate edits simpler.


How to Use:


  • Select Your Component: Click on the main component you wish to duplicate within your Figma file.
  • Activate the Plugin: Go to Plugins > Duplicate Main Component.
  • Instant Duplication: The plugin clones the selected component and positions it neatly below the original.
  • Edit As Needed: Your duplicate is now ready for any modifications or adjustments.


Ideal For:


  • Designers working with extensive UI component libraries.
  • Teams needing a quick way to create variations of a master component.
  • Anyone looking to enhance their efficiency in Figma.


Save Time, Enhance Productivity:


'Duplicate Main Component' is more than just a cloning tool; it's a productivity booster for your design process in Figma. Say goodbye to tedious manual duplication and hello to streamlined design workflows.
